blog.name: 0-aredhel-0
blog.title: It's peanut butter jelly time!
blog.description:
[COMMISSIONS ARE ON HIATUS] 
--> http://0-aredhel-0.tumblr.com/post/122257624926/open-commisions-you-can-contact-me-via-tumblr

Spanish girl, 28.

DC, Batman, Robin. Dick, as in penis and as in Richard. MARVEL. Avengers. X-MEN. Captain America. Blacksad. 

Tolkien. Harry Potter. Les Misérables. A Song of Ice and Fire. The Outsiders. The Hunger Games. The Princess Bride. The Name of the Wind. The Raven Cycle. Skulduggery Pleasant.

Star Wars. Disney. Ghibli. The Fall. Tim Burton. Pacific Rim. Star Trek. LAIKA. 

Avatar. Steven Universe. Voltron: Legendary Defender. Gravity Falls. Phineas&Ferb. Haikyuu!! DCMK. Digimon. Neon Génesis Evangelion. Over the Garden Wall. Drawn Together. FMA.

Parks & Recreation. Penny Dreadful. Criminal Minds. Firefly. Once Upon a Time. Scrubs. Buffy the Vampire Slayer. Misfits. House MD. FRIENDS. Pushing Daisies. Supernatural. Sherlock. Teen Wolf. Hannibal. Community. Orange is the new black. Brooklyn 99. Wynonna Earp. Sense8. A Series of Unfortunate Events. The Umbrella Academy.

Kingdom Hearts. Final Fantasy VIII. Ace Attorney. Prof. Layton.

GOT7. VIXX. Seventeen. Monsta X.

Hamilton.

Ask me anything! I love talking to you guys C:

blog.title: the slowest burn of all time

tags: this is kinda short but hey it's a thing
based loosely off the song friends will be friends by queen
i might do more queen themed ficlets if you guys wanna see more
summary: Friends Will Be Friends ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ After everything, Crowley finds himself feeling exhausted.  Which is quite...
body:
Friends Will Be Friends

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

After everything, Crowley finds himself feeling exhausted.

Which is quite the feat; demons don’t typically get tired. Neither do angels, sleep is not a necessary bodily function for such beings. Crowley’s learned that sleep is a glorious thing and has been doing it since the ninth century, but it had always been a choice, a part of human life he was choosing to partake in.

But when he enters the bookshop with Aziraphale after their lunch at the Ritz, he’s suddenly feeling exhausted.

Aziraphale is never tired, and that holds true even now. But Crowley can’t blame him, it’s the first time he’s been in the shop since the fire, and his excitement is damn near palpable. The demon leans against a nearby wall and watches with nothing short of fondness as his angel flutters about eagerly, looking over the old books he’s spent the last few thousand years falling in love with. Upon seeing the new set of books tucked neatly away in their own spot, his attention is ultimately drawn back to Crowley.

“Those are new.” Crowley shrugs and stifles a yawn.

“Are they? I’m quite sure I’ve seen them here before,” he hums. Aziraphale’s smile is soft now.

“Thank you, my dear.”

“No need.” Aziraphale’s back to bustling about and Crowley is sure he could watch this all day, every day for the rest of eternity. But he was wrong, because the next time the angel looks his way he’s practically falling asleep on his own two feet. Aziraphale shakes his head and makes his way over to his old friend- who maybe, over the course of the past few days, has become something more than a friend- and gently takes him by the arm.

“You know there’s a sofa in the back,” he hums. Crowley allows himself to be led to said piece of furniture.

“Sofa, right.” He drops down on it as soon as they reach it and Aziraphale removes the demon’s jacket and sunglasses with a tenderness that makes Crowley feel even more at ease; a feat he didn’t believe was possible.

They say the eyes are the window to the soul, and angels are especially gifted at reading what hides behind those windows. The moment Crowley’s glasses come off, Aziraphale can tell something’s on his mind, and he has a pretty good idea of what it is. But it will wait for now, he decides. There’s a more pressing matter at hand.

While Aziraphale sets the jacket and sunglasses down, Crowley removes his shoes and reclines against the soft cushions beneath him. It takes a real miracle to keep him from falling asleep immediately. The angel shuffles to the other side of the room and comes back with an old throw blanket, draping it over the other’s frame. Crowley smiles gratefully.

“You know, I rather like sleep,” he hums, stifling another yawn. “Wonderful invention, absolutely glorious. I could sleep forever really. Or a century.” He has slept a century away, the angel remembers that hundred years well. Aziraphale shakes his head in amusement (and perhaps as a method of clearing his head of any thought of the fifteenth century).

“Not quite as glorious as tea, but you do have a point.” Crowley’s too tired to make a proper response so he simply sticks his tongue out at the angel and hisses before closing his eyes. Aziraphale smiles as he moves to leave the room, offering a quiet “sweet dreams, my dear”, as he went, but when he gets to the door he can’t help but pause and look back at Crowley, curled up and cozy on the couch.

Aziraphale wants to open up shop and get back to the way things have been since the sixteenth century. He wants to make sure his books are all in order (even though he knows Crowley likely already made sure of that). But perhaps more than those wants there’s a need tugging at his heart, and after a few seconds’ pause he decides to ignore his wants for the time being. He makes his way to the front of the store, makes sure the sign is flipped to close, and returns to the back room with Crowley. He isn’t sure if the demon is fully asleep, but he doesn’t so much as stir while Aziraphale carefully lifts his head and shoulders so that he can take a seat, letting Crowley’s head rest on his lap now. One hand reaches for one of the demon’s hands, and he brings it to his lips to leave a kiss (if he’d been paying attention he would have seen Crowley’s faint smile at the gesture), before he grabs the nearest book and begins to read.

His demon is bothered, he saw it in his eyes. They’ll talk about it, Aziraphale will do everything in his angelic power to make it better. But for now, Crowley sleeps. And Aziraphale will keep him company until he wakes up. Perhaps even longer than that.

reblog.comment:
Friends Will Be Friends

blog.name: twifairy
blog.title: the chaos couldn't keep you from running into me

summary: I keep seeing people in the Good Omens tag talk about how they’d love to see Aziraphale and Crowley having to raise a child...
body:
I keep seeing people in the Good Omens tag talk about how they’d love to see Aziraphale and Crowley having to raise a child together.

You fools. You absolute buffoons. What do you think they were doing with Warlock for eleven years.

These idiots did not spend over a decade raising the wrong kid for this kind of erasure

reblog.comment:

summary: HOW DO YOU THINK CROWLEY WOULD REACT TO SEEING HOW THE OTHER ANGELS TREAT HIS ARIZAPHALE?? I might write this as a story tbh...
question: HOW DO YOU THINK CROWLEY WOULD REACT TO SEEING HOW THE OTHER ANGELS TREAT HIS ARIZAPHALE?? I might write this as a story tbh it’s been in my brain for the last like 3 days lol
answer:
diufjsiuiusdf i sAW YOU POST ABOUT THIS AND GOT SO HYPED OMG

honestly, i think he’d be torn between giving them a piece of his mind and not wanting to upset his angel, since zira doesn’t really hate them. BUT that doesn’t mean he won’t call them out if he’s there and they’re not treating zira with the respect he deserves!

trail.content:
diufjsiuiusdf i sAW YOU POST ABOUT THIS AND GOT SO HYPED OMG

honestly, i think he’d be torn between giving them a piece of his mind and not wanting to upset his angel, since zira doesn’t really hate them. BUT that doesn’t mean he won’t call them out if he’s there and they’re not treating zira with the respect he deserves!

tags: everyone's art has been so good!! I'm trying to get better at art.. slowly!
summary: I like to think these two didn’t come up with the switcheroo idea until after they’d ~spent the night together.~ Solves the...
caption:
I like to think these two didn’t come up with the switcheroo idea until after they’d ~spent the night together.~

Solves the “couldn’t heaven/hell smell it was a lie?” question. 😈😇

summary: Crowley:’Ugh pet names are the worst, i never want to be called baby. Just call me by my name thanks” Crowley when talking to...
body:
Crowley:’Ugh pet names are the worst, i never want to be called baby. Just call me by my name thanks”

Crowley when talking to Aziraphale:”My angel, my sweetheart, love of my life. My beloved angel.
